article_title: Smith & Wesson Posts Strong Results as Gun Debate Stirs
article_text:
Smith & Wesson Holding Corp. reported better-than-expected results Tuesday and raised its annual outlook as investors expect a renewed gun debate in the U.S. to drive sales.

The company said it now expects sales between $625 million and $635 million for the fiscal year, up from a previous forecast of $610 million to $620 million. The gun maker also said it expects adjusted earnings for the year to land between $1.26 a share and...
